N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 77.2 - The site and space utilization plan

State Regulations
(a) Each hospital for the mentally ill, school for the mentally retarded and alcoholism facility shall prepare and
maintain a site and space utilization plan for all existing physical facilities
utilized whether on the main site or elsewhere. The site and space utilization
plan and amendments thereto shall be submitted to the department. The site and
space utilization plan shall contain all information as specified in this
section. (b) The site and space
utilization plan shall include a description of the site specifying the
following: (1)

The location of the facility, and specification of the local regulatory authorities governing zoning, planning, health, fire prevention and sanitation. (2)

Means of access to the facility, including public and private roads and public transportation serving the
site. (3)

The physical properties
of the site including: (i) A property map
which indicates the property lines and existing improvements. (ii)

The operation of the facility under a
zoning ordinance or special permit, if applicable. (iii)

The characteristics of the immediate
neighborhood of the facility including the residential composition and land use
surrounding the property. (iv)

The
circulation through the property including the size and materials of the roads
and parking areas and existence of any public thoroughfare on the
site. (v) The size and capacity of
electric service, water, gas, and sewage facilities. (vi)

Size and location of existing outdoor
recreation areas such as pools, playgrounds and gardens. (vii)

The location and physical description
of the existing buildings, including dimensions and architectural features, and
existence of any bodies of water, natural woods, precipices, or other natural
features posing potential hazard. Photographs should be included when
appropriate. (viii)

Areas consigned
to others for use unrelated to the operation of the facility. (c) All existing
buildings on the site of the facility shall be described in detail. The
description shall specify for each: (1)

The
name of the building and number, if any. (2)

Its primary use by the
facility. (3)
A general description
of the construction type and materials, mechanical systems in use and
connections with facility systems and the building's size. (d) Floor plans drawn to scale shall be
submitted and all major spaces within each building must be tabulated and
briefly analyzed in terms of use. The analysis should indicate the name, specialized function, and intensity of use of each major space. For example: Name

Area

Lounge
600 sq. ft. Used by ambulatory patients primarily during
evening hours. Kitchenette and storage adjacent. 12 patients peak
use. (e) The site and space utilization plan shall
describe proposed improvements to the property, if any, whether requiring
approval of the commissioner in accordance with Part 74 of this Title or not. These descriptions shall include the following: (1)

Type of improvement; whether an addition, remodeling of the existing facility, or new building to be
constructed. (2)
A time schedule
which indicates the expected completion date of construction phases. (3)

Space analysis of the proposed
improvements should be tabulated as in subdivision (d) of this
section. (4)

The number of patients
or residents ultimately to be served by the improvements should be
specified. Notes
